Scripts¶

ChordGenerator¶

Script that generates all chords with their intervals and notes.

Imports¶

json: to write data as json to disk.

notes: import notes.note_list to use as chord roots.

intervals: import intervals.all_intervals to sort chord intervals.

chords: import chords.get_chord_notes() to get the notes of chords generated.

Global variables¶

chordgenerator.thirds: dict¶

Contains third intervals and their chord tones.

chordgenerator.fifths: dict¶

Contains fifth intervals and their chord tones.

chordgenerator.sevenths: dict¶

Contains seventh intervals and their chord tones.

chordgenerator.ninths: dict¶

Contains ninth intervals and their chord tones.

chordgenerator.elevenths: dict¶

Contains eleventh intervals and their chord tones.

chordgenerator.thirteenths: dict¶

Contains thirteenth intervals and their chord tones.

chordgenerator.roots: list¶

A copy of the variable notes.note_list.

Functions¶

format_name(): format chord names.

generate_triads(): generate chord triads.

generate_sus(): generated suspended chords.

add_sevenths(): add sevenths to chords.

add_extensions(): add extensions to chords.

chordgenerator.format_name(root, chord_name)¶

Format chord name to standards.

First, declares a variable to store the new name, then uses conditionals to:

  1. Eliminate separators in appropriate extended chord cases.

  2. Format diminished chords to have no separator at the end.

  3. Replace separator with parenthesis in appropriate cases.

  4. Eliminate double separators.

Lastly, return the new chord name.

Parameters

  • root (string) – the root of the chord, used in f-strings.

  • chord_name (string) – old chord name.

Returns

the formatted chord name.

Return type

string

chordgenerator.generate_triads(root)¶

Generate chord triads with their corresponding intervals.

Defines empty variables chord_name, for each chord’s name, chord_intervals for each chord’s intervals, name_list for a list of all triad names and interval_list for a list of all triad intervals.

Then, iterates through thirds and through fifths, assigning respective intervals to chord_intervals. Iterates through the fifth chord tones and, using conditionals, create the standard chord names along their interval sets. Last, returns both list variables as output.

Variables

  • chord_name – name of each chord to be created.

  • chord_intervals – intervals of each chord to be created.

Parameters

root (string) – root of the chords to be created.

Returns

the lists of chord names and interval sets.

Return type

lists

Modules¶

Notes¶

Module with note variables and the means to make a chromatic scale.

Global variables¶

notes.naturals: list¶

Contains the seven natural notes.

notes.accidents: list of tuples¶

Contains the five musical accidents, with the names in tuples.

notes.all_notes: list¶

Contains all notes, with enharmonics in tuples.

notes.sharp_keys: list¶

Contains all keys which have sharps in them.

notes.flat_keys: list¶

Contains all keys which have flats in them.

notes.note_list: list¶

Contains all note names.

Functions¶

is_accidental(): check if note has an accident.

is_sharp(): check if note is sharp.

is_flat(): check if note is flat.

enharmonize(): take an accidental note and return its equivalent.

get_chroma(): gets the chromatic scale of a given root.

notes.enharmonize(note)¶

Get an equivalent name of a note.

Check if note is_accidental() then, if true, iterate through accidents and return the other value in the note’s tuple. Otherwise return the original note.

Parameters

note (str) – a given note

Returns

the equivalent (enharmonic) name of the note

Return type

str

notes.get_chroma(root)¶

Take a root and return its chromatic scale.

Transform all_notes in a string, then use list comprehension to filter out the unused sharps or flats. Lastly, use list slicing to set the root as the first note of the scale.

Parameters

root (str) – given note to be used as scale’s root

Returns

the chromatic scale

Return type

list

notes.is_accidental(note)¶

Check if a note has an accident.

Iterate through accidents and, if the argument is found, return True.

Parameters

note (str) – a given note

Return type

bool

notes.is_flat(note)¶

Check if a note is sharp.

Iterate through accidents and, if the argument is the last value in one of the tuples, return True.

Parameters

note (str) – a given note

Return type

bool

notes.is_sharp(note)¶

Check if a note is sharp.

Iterate through accidents and, if the argument is the first value in one of the tuples, return True.

Parameters

note (str) – a given note

Return type

bool

Intervals¶

Module with a list of all intervals and their functions.

Imports¶

notes: import functions and globals.

Global variables¶

intervals.interval_list: list¶

List with all intervals, including enharmonics in tuples.

intervals.all_intervals: list¶

List with all interval names.

Functions¶

is_unison(): check for unison interval.

is_minor(): check for minor intervals.

is_major(): check for major intervals.

is_diminished(): check for diminished intervals.

is_perfect(): check for perfect intervals.

is_augmented(): check for augmented intervals.

get_note(): get the second note of an interval.

get_interval(): get the interval between two notes.

intervals.get_interval(first_note, last_note)¶

Get the interval between two notes.

Make a chromatic scale with the first note, check the second note’s index on it and return the interval with that index on interval_list.

Returns

the name of the interval between two given notes

Return type

str

intervals.get_note(first_note, interval)¶

Get second note of an interval.

Make a chromatic scale based on the first note, get the index of the interval on interval_list, as it will be the index of the second note on the first one’s scale, then use said index to retrieve the second note.

Parameters

  • first_note (str) – first note of the interval.

  • interval (str) – name of the interval.

Returns

the second note of the interval.

Return type

str

intervals.is_augmented(interval)¶

Check if interval is in list of augmented intervals.

intervals.is_diminished(interval)¶

Check if interval is in list of diminished intervals.

intervals.is_major(interval)¶

Check if interval is in list of major intervals.

intervals.is_minor(interval)¶

Check if interval is in list of minor intervals.

intervals.is_perfect(interval)¶

Check if interval is in list of perfect intervals.

intervals.is_unison(interval)¶

Check if given interval is unison.
